resources.string: Spell Tap
Welcome to Spell Tap! [Tap the screen to continue.]
You\'ve travelled for days, but your journey has just begun. At last, you stand before the world\'s top magic school: Spell Tap Academy. [Tap on a building to enter it.]
Tap on the Academy.
So you want to be a wizard? And partake in duels of sorcery? Then listen carefully...
Before any spells, you must learn to wield your knife. Physical violence may be the last resort, but many a wizard owes their life to combat training. I will first teach you to stab.
Starting from the lower part of the screen, slide your finger up ( ↑ ).
Good stab! Do it again.
Observe using the left half of the screen gives a left-handed stab, and using the right half gives a right-handed stab.
You show promise. Meet me at the training hall.
Jack awaits you at the training hall.
Stab this wooden dummy 3 times to destroy it. Do the stab motion, then tap the bottom of the screen.
Well done. But let\'s see how you handle hostile targets.
Very funny, though strictly speaking you did destroy the dummy. You\'re lucky I know the Raise Dead spell.
Very funny. You\'re lucky I know the Raise Dead spell. We\'ll move on, even though you lost to a wooden dummy.
Clearly you know how to target your spells, so we\'ll skip a lesson. Train more on the dummy, If you like. Then see me at the Academy for your first magic lesson.
You must direct your first stabs to the goblins. Make a Knife gesture, then drag your finger from the Stab icon to a goblin.
You learn fast. Come see me at the Academy for your first magic lesson. Or you can stab a few more dummies first.
You\'re lucky I know the Raise Dead spell. Let\'s try that again.
The Palm magic gesture is easy, but powerful.
Drag your finger downwards ( ↓ ) in the lower part of the screen to make the Palm gesture (P).
Good. In a duel, you could cast Shield now.
Great! Shield protects you from all physical attacks.
Take care. Gesturing Palm with both hands means you surrender! You lose at the end of the round, unless your opponent is dead.
Now go to the Arena for your first duel. Or pracice more at the Training Hall.
Sendin is your next opponent. Cast Shield to block his stabs.
Sendin is your next opponent. Cast Shield to block his stabs.
A draw is not good enough. With the Shield spell you should be able to win easily.
Well done. Let's pick up the pace.
Let\'s try it again, shall we?
Do a Snap gesture (S) by drawing a diagonally up and away from the center, like a Knife gesture that veers outwards (L: ↖ R: ↗ ). Make Snap with both hands and end your turn.
Now, the Digit gesture (D) is the same except you go toward to center (L: ↗ R: ↖ ). Make Digit with both hands and end the turn.
Surprise! S followed by D casts Missile. Unlike Shield, most spells take several turns to cast.
To make a Wave gesture (W), run your finger diagonally downwards and away from the center (L: ↙ R: ↘ ). Wave both hands and end your turn.
Now make the Fingers gesture (F) on both hands: run a finger diagonally downwards and towards the center (L: ↘ R: ↙ ). Then end your turn.
Perfect! Now gesture Palm with both hands. Normally this loses, but since WFP is Cause Light Wounds, you can do 4 points of damage to kill your opponent.
If you kill the opponent, you win even if you gesture Palm with both hands.
One more thing. A single gesture can only complete one spell, so you must choose Cause Light Wounds over Shield by tapping its icon.
Well done! Cause Light Wounds deals 2 damage even to shielded targets.
Almost. Try again.
Your next opponent always tries to cast Shield on himself.
Cause Light Wounds (WFP) may help. Another handy spell is Confusion (DSF): its target must gesture identically with both hands. Good luck!
Impressive!
This is a tough fight. Don\'t lose heart!
I\'ll let you pass, but remember you won\'t always have someone around to cast Raise Dead on you.
